result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick M Arrowood

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in court.  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CM270, 15CM210, 16CT21 @ 1:30 pm.  State gives 15CM270, ct's 1 & 2, ct 3 DRI, 15CM210 DRI & 16CT21 DRI, 15CM270, withheld sentence 18 months probation, costs, Complete AODA & follow through & any other counseling deemed appropriate by agent, DNA Sample & surcharge & 5 days credit. Atty Glascock & def. agree with plea agreement.  Complied with victim rights in 15CM210.  Plea questionnaire already filed. Court goes over rights. Def. understands charge & penalties. Ct 1 Poss of Cntrl Substance, repeater, no contest plea, Ct 2 Bailjumping, repeater, no contest.  Ct 3 DRI, 15CM210 & 16CT21, DRI on both cases.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. Def. understands elements.  Def. admits of prior convictions. Atty Glascock is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given. Factual basis stipulated.  Court finds factual basis, accept pleas & finds def. Guilty to Poss of Cntrl Substance, repeater, in ct 1 & Bailjumping, repeater, ct 2.  State gives sentencing recommendation. Atty Glascock gives sentencing recommendation. Def. makes statement.  Court orders on 15CM270 ct 1 withheld prison sentence 18 months probation, costs, DNA Sample & $200.00 DNA surcharge, Completion of AODA & follow through & any other counseling as deemed appropriate by agent. 5 days credit, time served  ct 2 withheld prison sentence 18 months probation, concurrent, costs, same conditions as ct 1, 200 DNA surcharge, 5 days credit if revoked.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights. Bond applied to costs.

Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in court with attorney Zachary Paul Glascock.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CM270, 15CM210, 16CT21 @ 11:38 a.m. Agreement stated - 15CM270 def will plead to ct 2, with 1 yr probation, Off record briefly. Back on the record. Agreement stated by Atty Glascock -  15CM270 plead to ct 1 & 2, 15CM210, 16CT21 will be dismissed and read in.    16 CT 21  copy received, waive reading, not guilty plea at this time. Statement by D.A. regarding victim rights.  Off the record 11:42. Back on the record 11:48. 16CT21 - Court receives not guilty plea and directs entry in record. All cases rescheduled for plea/sent. Bonds remain. Def to report for booking on 16CT21. State heard on bond for 16CT21. Court orders $500 signature bond w/condition.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
